value.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match."
value.name: CVE-2009-5155

value.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match."
value.name: CVE-2009-5155

BulkDelete.description: An array of Digests to be deleted.
BulkDelete.title: BulkDelete

Callback.description: A callback for clients to retrieve notifications

callback.description: the url where notifications can be retrieved

notification_id.description: the unique identifier for this set of notifications

Callback.title: Callback

Digest.description:
A digest string with prefixed algorithm. The format is described here: https://github.com/opencontainers/image-spec/blob/master/descriptor.md#digests
Digests are used throughout the API to identify Layers and Manifests.
Digest.title: Digest

Distribution.description: An indexed distribution discovered in a layer. See https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/os-release.html for explanations and example of fields.

id.description: A unique ID representing this distribution

Distribution.title: Distribution

Environment.description: The environment a particular package was discovered in.

distribution_id.description: The distribution ID found in an associated IndexReport or VulnerabilityReport.

package_db.description: The filesystem path or unique identifier of a package database.

Environment.title: Environment

Error.description: A general error schema returned when status is not 200 OK

code.description: a code for this particular error

Error.title: Error

IndexReport.description: A report of the Index process for a particular manifest. A client's usage of this is largely information. Clair uses this report for matching Vulnerabilities.

distributions.description: A map of Distribution objects keyed by their Distribution.id discovered in the manifest.

environments.description: A map of lists containing Environment objects keyed by the associated Package.id.

err.description: An error message on event of unsuccessful index

packages.description: A map of Package objects indexed by Package.id

state.description: The current state of the index operation

IndexReport.title: IndexReport

Layer.description: A Layer within a Manifest and where Clair may retrieve it.

headers.description: map of arrays of header values keyed by header value. e.g. map[string][]string

uri.description: A URI describing where the layer may be found. Implementations MUST support http(s) schemes and MAY support additional schemes.

Layer.title: Layer

Manifest.description: A Manifest representing a container. The 'layers' array must preserve the original container's layer order for accurate usage.
Manifest.title: Manifest

Notification.description: A notification expressing a change in a manifest affected by a vulnerability.

id.description: a unique identifier for this notification

manifest.description: The hash of the manifest affected by the provided vulnerability.

reason.description: the reason for the notifcation, [added | removed]

Notification.title: Notification

Package.description: A package discovered by indexing a Manifest

id.description: A unique ID representing this package

module.description: A module further defining a namespace for a package

Package.title: Package

Page.description: A page object indicating to the client how to retrieve multiple pages of a particular entity.

next.description: The next id to submit to the api to continue paging

size.description: The maximum number of elements in a page

Page.title: Page

PagedNotifications.description: A page object followed by a list of notifications

notifications.description: A list of notifications within this page

page.description: A page object informing the client the next page to retrieve. If page.next becomes "-1" the client should stop paging.

PagedNotifications.title: PagedNotifications

SourcePackage.description: A source package affiliated with a Package

id.description: A unique ID representing this package

SourcePackage.title: SourcePackage

Version.description: Version is a normalized claircore version, composed of a "kind" and an array of integers such that two versions of the same kind have the correct ordering when the integers are compared pair-wise.
Version.title: Version

description.example: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match."

fixed_in_version.description: The version which the vulnerability is fixed in. Empty if not fixed.

links.description: links to external information about vulnerability

normalized_severity.description: A well defined set of severity strings guaranteed to be present.

Vulnerability.description: A unique vulnerability indexed by Clair

description.description: A description of this specific vulnerability.

fixed_in_version.description: A unique ID representing this vulnerability.

id.description: A unique ID representing this vulnerability.

issued.description: The timestamp in which the vulnerability was issued

links.description: A space separate list of links to any external information.

normalized_severity.description: A well defined set of severity strings guaranteed to be present.

range.description: The range of package versions affected by this vulnerability.

severity.description: A severity keyword taken verbatim from the vulnerability source.

updater.description: A unique ID representing this vulnerability.

Vulnerability.title: Vulnerability

VulnerabilityReport.description: A report expressing discovered packages, package environments, and package vulnerabilities within a Manifest.

distributions.description: A map of Distribution objects indexed by Distribution.id.

environments.description: A mapping of Environment lists indexed by Package.id

package_vulnerabilities.description: A mapping of Vulnerability.id lists indexed by Package.id.

packages.description: A map of Package objects indexed by Package.id

vulnerabilities.description: A map of Vulnerabilities indexed by Vulnerability.id

VulnerabilityReport.title: VulnerabilityReport

info.description: ClairV4 is a set of cooperating microservices which scan, index, and match your container's content with known vulnerabilities.
info.title: ClairV4

delete.description: Given a Manifest's content addressable hash, any data related to it will be removed if it exists.
delete.summary: Delete the IndexReport and associated information for the given Manifest hashes, if they exist.

post.description: By submitting a Manifest object to this endpoint Clair will fetch the layers, scan each layer's contents, and provide an index of discovered packages, repository and distribution information.
post.summary: Index the contents of a Manifest

delete.description: Given a Manifest's content addressable hash, any data related to it will be removed it it exists.

parameters.description: A digest of a manifest that has been indexed previous to this request.
parameters.name: manifest_hash

delete.summary: Delete the IndexReport and associated information for the given Manifest hash, if exists.

get.description: Given a Manifest's content addressable hash an IndexReport will be retrieved if exists.

parameters.description: A digest of a manifest that has been indexed previous to this request.
parameters.name: manifest_hash

get.summary: Retrieve an IndexReport for the given Manifest hash if exists.

get.description:
The index state endpoint returns a json structure indicating the indexer's internal configuration state.
A client may be interested in this as a signal that manifests may need to be re-indexed.
get.summary: Report the indexer's internal configuration and state.

get.description: Given a Manifest's content addressable hash a VulnerabilityReport will be created. The Manifest **must** have been Indexed first via the Index endpoint.

parameters.description: A digest of a manifest that has been indexed previous to this request.
parameters.name: manifest_hash

get.summary: Retrieve a VulnerabilityReport for a given manifest's content addressable hash.

delete.description: Issues a delete of the provided notification id and all associated notifications. After this delete clients will no longer be able to retrieve notifications.

parameters.description: A notification ID returned by a callback
parameters.name: notification_id

get.description: By performing a GET with a notification_id as a path parameter, the client will retrieve a paginated response of notification objects.

parameters.description: A notification ID returned by a callback
parameters.name: notification_id

parameters.description: The maximum number of notifications to deliver in a single page.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: The next page to fetch via id. Typically this number is provided on initial response in the page.next field. The first GET request may omit this field.
parameters.name: next

get.summary: Retrieve a paginated result of notifications for the provided id.
